intro: Gnaphalium chilense, commonly known as the Chilean feather grass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to dry conditions such as reduced leaf size and dense foliage. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in compact clusters, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium chilense is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and drought tolerance.
